intro: Wenzelia tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf wenzelia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or white. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
